basics.name: Lauren Alexandra
basics.title: Data Scientist
basics.summary: A data scientist with a research focus in climate-informed modeling for ecosystem management with a particular emphasis on applied solutions in mitigating the impacts of hydroclimate variability.

work.name: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory
work.summary: At the Environmental Molecular Sciences Laboratory user facility in PNNL I have primarily developed a data and project platform designed for environmental researchers, but within the broader lab I have collaborated with earth scientists on applied research, leveraging machine learning models to understand climate security risk.

work.name: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory
work.summary: Implemented machine learning infrastructure for efficient experiment tracking on high-performance computing systems to support reproducibility.

volunteer.summary: Collecting hydrological data in the Cosumnes River Watershed by recording field measurements, documenting habitat conditions, and observing species including endangered and at risk species in the western Sierra river. Data is uploaded to the California Environmental Data Exchange Network and supports partner research (UC Davis) on the watershed impacts from the Caldor Fire (2021).

education.institution: Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences at the University of Colorado Boulder

courses: Applying Machine Learning and Neural Networks

certificates.name: Water in the Western United States
